did.unittitle: Charles Deane Letter, Cambridge, Mass., to Samuel Eliot, Oct. 17, 1879.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Special Collections Librarian/ Associate Curator of Rare Books and Manuscripts, and the holder of the copyright, if not the Rockefeller Library at Colonial Williamsburg.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Charles Deane Letter, Cambridge, Mass., to Samuel Eliot, 1879 Oct. 17, Manuscript 1937.5, John D. Rockefeller, Jr. Library, Colonial Williamsburg Foundation

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Charles Deane was a merchant with the firm of Waterston, Pray & Company. He retired from the firm in 1864 and devoted himself to the research early American history.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Single letter from Deane to Eliot, apparently answering a question about the introduction of slaves into Virginia.
